result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven M King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

STAYED.
STRAIGHT TIME.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
No alcohol or drugs for any reason.
No contact with Amanda K unless with prior Agent approval of Agent.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

defendant.name: King, Steven M
defendant.address: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied. Modified .15cent balance

Defendant Steven M King in court, in custody, with attorney J A Rosario.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1 & 3 Dismissed and Read-In.  

Court orders the following: 
Count 2:
- 90 days Jail straight time credit 16 days STAYED for 1 year Probation
- Court costs of $343.00 (Includes DV Surcharge) to be paid as a condition of Probation; alternate 7 days jail consecutive
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alchol/drugs for any reason.  Submit to a formal AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  No contact with Amanda K unless with prior approval of agent.  DNA surcharge is waived.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Steven M King in court, in custody, with attorney J A Rosario.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven M King
Current: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 04-28-2014)
Prior: 1209 W Wisconsin Ave #14, Oconomowoc, WI 53066

Defendant Steven M King in court, in custody, with attorney J A Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Rosario requests to address bail modification. State requests some cash bail. Court denies modification of bail.   Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary Hearing requested within 10 days.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint or her residence.  Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Steven M King in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
